eu.focusnet.app.controller

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.focusnet.app.controller.UserManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApplicationStatusObserver

    public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ApplicationStatusObserver
    This class is responsible for handling user-related tasks, such as authentication and access control.

      • demoUseCase

        private java.lang.String demoUseCase
        Deprecated. This is only used in the prototype of the application.
        The currently selected use case identifier for the prototype. This is one of the values listed in R.string.demo_use_cases_values.

      • userUrl

        private java.lang.String userUrl
        URI to resource holding user information.

        URIs to resources that are used for building the application. 3 objects are of special importance and mandatory for the application to work properly: - userUrl points to a User object, which contains basic information such as the user's name - prefUrl points to a UserPreferences object, which contains e.g. bookmarks - appContentUrl points to a AppContentTemplate object, which contains the template used to generate the content of the application.

      • prefUrl

        private java.lang.String prefUrl
        URI to resource holding user information.
        See Also:
        #userUrl;

      • appContentUrl

        private java.lang.String appContentUrl
        URI to resource holding application template.

        Tells whether the user is logged in or not.

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String server)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Login

        FIXME TODO implementation to be completed once we have an authentication server.

        Parameters:
        user - The login user
        password - The login password
        server - The login server
        Returns:
        true on successful authentication, false otherwise (403 error)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs

      • demoLogin

        public boolean demoLogin(java.lang.String useCase)
        Deprecated. Only valid for the prototype
        A temporary and more simple login-like function that will retrieve all information from resources (R.string.demo_use_cases_labels, R.string.demo_use_cases_app_content_uris). These resources are stored as string-arrays, and the selected use case properties share the same array index as the one of the selected as it can be found in R.string#demo_use_cases_values.
        Parameters:
        useCase - the identifier of the use case selected by the user, as it can be found in R.string#demo_use_cases_values.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a network error occured

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Delete login information and any locally stored data

      • getUser

        public UserInstance getUser()
                     throws FocusMissingResourceException
        The UserInstance is one of the 3 mandatory objects for the application to run. This method retrieves this object based on the URI that has been obtained during the login procedure. If the object does not exist, a new one is created on the network.

        The application cannot live without this object and will therefore crash if it does not succeed in retrieving or creating this object.

        Returns:
        A UserInstance object
        Throws:
        FocusMissingResourceException

      • getUserAsIs

        public UserInstance getUserAsIs()
        Return the user in its current state. This is useful because the FocusObject
        Returns:
        The current UserInstance, or null if it is not set, yet.

      • getUserPreferences

        public UserPreferencesInstance getUserPreferences()
                                           throws FocusMissingResourceException
        The UserPreferencesInstance is one of the 3 mandatory objects for the application to run. This method retrieves this object based on the URI that has been obtained during the login procedure. If the object does not exist, a new one is created on the network.

        The application cannot live without this object and will therefore crash if it does not succeed in retrieving or creating this object.

        Returns:
        A UserPreferencesInstance object
        Throws:
        FocusMissingResourceException

      • getUserPreferencesOrNull

        public UserPreferencesInstance getUserPreferencesOrNull()
        Get the user preferences, but do return null if their are not found.

      • getUserData

        public void getUserData()
                 throws FocusMissingResourceException
        Those 2 objects are mandatory, and fatal exception is triggered if something goes wrong.
        Throws:
        FocusMissingResourceException
